facts.fact_text: Croatia's trade deficit slightly widened to EUR 1.3 billion in December 2025, from EUR 1.2 billion in the same month of the previous year.

evidences.evidence_text: Croatia's trade deficit slightly widened to EUR 1.3 billion in December 2025, from EUR 1.2 billion in the same month of the previous year

facts.fact_text: Imports declined by 2.2% year-on-year to EUR 3.3 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Imports declined by 2.2% year-on-year to EUR 3.3 billion

facts.fact_text: Exports fell by 4.2% to EUR 2 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: exports fell by 4.2% to EUR 2 billion

facts.fact_text: For the whole of 2025, Croatia's trade deficit widened to EUR 19.2 billion, from EUR 18.8 billion in the same period a year earlier.

evidences.evidence_text: For the whole of 2025, the country's trade deficit widened to EUR 19.2 billion, from EUR 18.8 billion in the same period a year earlier.

facts.fact_text: Exports increased by 4.4% to EUR 25.1 billion in 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: During this period, exports increased by 4.4% to EUR 25.1 billion

facts.fact_text: Imports grew by 3.3% to EUR 44.3 billion in 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, imports grew by 3.3% to EUR 44.3 billion

evidence.evidence_text: During this period, exports increased by 4.4% to EUR 25.1 billion, supported by higher sales to both EU (5.6%) and non-EU (2.2%) countries.
Meanwhile, imports grew by 3.3% to EUR 44.3 billion, mainly driven by increased purchases from both EU (1.2%) and non-EU (10.5%) countries.
Croatia's trade deficit slightly widened to EUR 1.3 billion in December 2025, from EUR 1.2 billion in the same month of the previous year, as imports fell less than exports.
